docs.text: " battlefield earth " is the best comedy of the year .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it has to be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the other prospect is just too horrifying to consider .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: bad movie syndrome struck me again , so after witnessing how much " battlefield earth " has been proclaimed a train wreck in both critical and popular circles , i felt the masochistic urge to see the disaster first-hand .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: is it as bad as advertised ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh yes , very much so .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot is incomprehensible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the acting is atrocious .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the special effects are mediocre .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the action is dull .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the implausibilities are legion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the dialogue is cringe-inducing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the whole package is funny when it wants to be serious and irritating when it wants to be funny .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i don't even want to continue reviewing this movie ; i'd like to purge the atrocity from my mind as soon as possible , but you probably want to read my thrashing in all its sarcastic glory , so here it is :
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the premise is basically a rip-off of " planet of the apes , " only minus the apes and philosophical discussion , and plus a race of evil aliens from the planet psychlo .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the year is 3000 , the psychlos have conquered earth , and the human population has been enslaved .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only a handful of humans escaped to radiation-rich areas to escape the aliens ; they live out their lives in fear .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one man , johnny goodboy ( i know , i know ) tyler ( barry pepper ) , ventures to the outworld and is captured by the psychlos .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there he confronts the psychlo head of security : a big , ugly , klingon-looking creature called terl ( john travolta ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: pressed into slavery , johnny vows to lead a revolution and take the planet back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: meanwhile , terl is faced with his own problems : he has recently learned that he's stuck living on earth ( which he hates ) for the rest of his career because he pissed off his boss by sleeping with the big man's daughter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he decides to give johnny knowledge of the psychlo language and technology ( this is where the plot gets ridiculous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so the " man-animal " can lead a mining expedition into places the psychlos can't go .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: terl then plans to keep the mined gold for himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , his plan doesn't work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so many things wrong with this movie -- where to begin ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how about with travolta , whose hollywood clout brought about this , the cinematic version of scientology guru l . ron hubbard's sci-fi novel ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: early previews for " battlefield earth , " with constant shots of a makeup-laden travolta cackling like lex luthor , had me ( and several audience members ) remarking , " what the hell is travolta thinking ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie did nothing to stem such remarks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all that ridiculous cackling he did in the trailers is in full force here : terl cackles after nearly every line , and so does every other psychlo .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , this makes every scene hilariously overwrought , no more so than when the script clumsily stumbles into political commentary .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the psychlos are probably supposed to be some kind of satire of corporate america , but ceos generally don't laugh maniacally after denying pay raises to their employees .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( " you were going to be promoted -- but now you're not !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fwahahahahahahahaha ! ! ! ! ! " )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's no big surprise terl loses to the humans -- he's an idiot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he breaks every kind of supervillain rule in the book .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he underestimates his enemies , assuming he'll win just because he's smarter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( he uses the word " leverage " like some sort of scientologist mantra . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not content to go the james bond villain route of explaining his plans to the hero , he hooks him up to a machine that gives him knowledge of all the psychlos' language and technology .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( why this machine is even around in the first place is beyond me . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he then appears shocked that johnny points a gun at him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no wonder this guy never got his promotion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot inconsistencies are too numerous to mention .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why do the psychlos build an earth base in which both they and the human slaves must wear little breathing apparatuses to survive ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how come the psychlos are wasting their time mining for gold when the doors of fort knox are wide open ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how in the world did all those fighter jets survive sitting in a hangar for 1 , 000 years ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and how do all these previously brain-dead cavemen learn to fly them so quickly ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a whole lot more to scratch one's head about in " battlefield earth . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: bring a scorecard to track the plot holes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director roger christian shoots " battlefield earth " in the most distracting way possible , tilting nearly every shot sideways for no discernible reason .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all the characters appear to be standing on the walls , and it's awfully difficult to watch a movie when you must tilt your head just to watch ordinary passages of dialogue .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the action sequences are atrociously edited , every one turned into an endless slow-motion parade that drains all potential excitement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: are these things really so hard to construct ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: my respect for supposed " lightweight " action directors has grown by leaps and bounds after witnessing in " battlefield earth " how badly an action sequence can be shot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this movie is an absolute headache .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not just the shot selection and editing ; the movie , quite frankly , makes no sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for most of " battlefield earth's " running time , i just didn't know what was happening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it didn't have anything to do with me finding the events stupid or illogical ( though they certainly are ) -- i really had no idea what the hell was going on .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when i pieced the plot together later , it didn't look any better .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here's how much of a disaster this is : " battlefield earth " is already the worst movie of the year , and it's going to take something really , really inept to top it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only thing we can take comfort in about the film is that no one will be suckered into joining the church of scientology because of it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in fact , i'd think that hubbard's cult would want to distance themselves from this bomb as fast as possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that'll teach me to give into bad movie syndrome again .
docs.label: negative
